CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator PERSON from ORG issued the most recent decision refusing to institute criminal proceedings . CARDINAL . A criminal case may be instituted on the basis of a criminal complaint if there is sufficient evidence of elements of a crime ( Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ) . A criminal case may be opened by a prosecutor or by an investigator with the prosecutor 's consent ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the CCrP ) .

CARDINAL . The victim is the individual who has suffered physical harm , emotional distress or pecuniary damage as a consequence of the crime . The victim has , in particular , the right to give statements , to take part in procedural acts , to put questions to experts , and to lodge requests ( Article CARDINAL of the CCrP ) .
